titleproper.value:
Guide to the New-York Historical Society Celebratory and Memorial Event Records
                    <lb/> 1854-1954
                    <lb/>
                    <num>NYHS-RG 12</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Larry Weimer

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2018-06-05T14:05-0400</date>

unittitle.value: New-York Historical Society celebratory and memorial event records

extent.value:
in 13 document boxes, two card boxes, 
and one oversize folder.

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: The New-York Historical Society celebratory and memorial event record group includes correspondence, invitations, event programs, tickets, and other material associated with about twenty of the special events held by N-YHS from 1854-1954. These events included major N-YHS anniversaries, commemorations of Washington Irving (1860) and William Cullen Bryant (1878), the completion of the Central Park West building (1939), and others. The record group also includes documents related to the Robert Fulton exhibition installed at N-YHS in 1909 in conjunction with the Hudson-Fulton Celebration.

p.value: Open to qualified researchers. One document box includes only excess copies of ephemera culled from some of the other folders in the record group; this box of redundant material is available for N-YHS staff use only.
This record group should be cited as New-York Historical Society celebratory and memorial event records (NYHS-RG 12), The New-York Historical Society.

(The principal source for this note was N-YHS Director R.W.G. Vail’s 
                <emph render="italic">Knickerbocker Birthday,</emph> published in conjunction with the institution’s sesqui-centennial anniversary in 1954. See especially the section “Elegant Dinners and Eloquent Diners” on pages 361-445.)

Some of the events include documents concerning the planning for the event itself. These can be found primarily in the case of the major N-YHS anniversaries, the Bryant commemoration, and the William Bradford/Introduction of printing to New York City commemmoration. Although N-YHS’s history of lecture series and other public programs do not appear prominently in the record group, there are two folders of documents concerning arrangements for lectures in the 1930s. Some documents concern the preparation of a memorial book for former Treasurer Robert Schell. There are two artifacts from the sesqui-centennial anniversary in the record group: two medals and a steel stamp.

corpname.value: New-York Historical Society. -- Centennial celebrations, etc.

dsc.value:
N-YHS Semi-Centennial (50th) Anniversary. Committee on Arrangements. Minute Book 1 1 1854 N-YHS Semi-Centennial (50th) Anniversary. Committee on Arrangements. Loose Sheets from Minute Book 1 2 1854, 1857 Scope and Contents Note

Includes some 1857 clippings related to the dedication of the new 2nd Ave. building.

 N-YHS Semi-Centennial (50th) Anniversary. Committee on Arrangements. Reports, Notes, Etc. 1 3 1854 N-YHS Semi-Centennial (50th) Anniversary. Correspondence 1 4 1854 Scope and Contents Note

Includes responses to invitations.

 N-YHS Semi-Centennial (50th) Anniversary. Print Matter 1 5 1854 Scope and Contents Note

Includes invitations, list of stewards, toasts, Theodore E. Tomlinson's "Tribute to Woman" (response to Luther Bradish's toast), event proceedings, George Bancroft's oration "The Necessity, the Reality, and the Promise of the Progress of the Human Race," and the menu from the Astor House, among other documents.

 N-YHS Semi-Centennial (50th) Anniversary. Documents from after the Event 1 6 1854-1855 Scope and Contents Note

Documents relate to the distribution of the proceedings and attempts to collect payments on ticket subscription commitments.

 N-YHS Semi-Centennial (50th) Anniversary. Clippings 1 7 1854 November Washington Irving Commemoration. December Meeting Resolutions, Etc. 1 8 1859 December Scope and Contents Note

Includes abstracts, correspondence, and speeches related to the December 6, 1859, N-YHS meeting at which Irving's death was announced, and the resolutions concerning holding a commemorative event in April 1860.

 Washington Irving Commemoration. Correspondence (1 of 5) 1 9 1860 March Scope and Contents Note

This set of folders principally includes responses to the invitations for tickets to the Irving celebration. See also: N-YHS General Correspondence (NYHS-RG 2), Series I, for a folder of many letters related to this event, including letters by William Cullen Bryant, Jared Sparks, Martin Van Buren, and others.

 Washington Irving Commemoration. Correspondence (2 of 5) 1 10 1860 March Washington Irving Commemoration. Correspondence (3 of 5) 1 11 1860 March Washington Irving Commemoration. Correspondence (4 of 5) 1 12 1860 March Washington Irving Commemoration. Correspondence (5 of 5) 1 13 1860 April Washington Irving Commemoration. Print Matter 1 14 1860 April Scope and Contents Note

Includes the featured orator Edward Everett's letter conveying a newspaper clipping of his remarks at the event, with his annotated corrections, event tickets, and other print matter.

 St. Nicholas Festival OS-1 10 1864 Scope and Contents Note

Includes three copies of the 1864 N-YHS document that reproduced John Pintard's 1810 festival document, with additional engravings. See also: Multiple additional copies of the 1864 reprint are also in the Print Room's Broadside Collection. The Print Room also holds one copy of the original 1810 document; see call number SY1810 no.94.

 66th Anniversary/Charles Francis Adams Address. Invitations and Tickets 2 1 1870 December 66th Anniversary/Charles Francis Adams Address. Correspondence (Ticket Requests) 2 2 1870 December 66th Anniversary/Charles Francis Adams Address. Clippings 2 3 1870 December 70th Anniversary/Richard S. Storrs Address. Correspondence (Ticket Requests) (1 of 4) 2 4 1875 April 70th Anniversary/Richard S. Storrs Address. Correspondence (Ticket Requests) (2 of 4) 2 5 1875 April 70th Anniversary/Richard S. Storrs Address. Correspondence (Ticket Requests) (3 of 4) 2 6 1875 April 70th Anniversary/Richard S. Storrs Address. Correspondence (Ticket Requests) (4 of 4) 2 7 1875 April 100th Anniversary of the New York State Constitution. Invitations and Tickets 2 8 1877 May 100th Anniversary of the New York State Constitution. Proceedings and other Notes 2 9 1877 May 100th Anniversary of the New York State Constitution. Correspondence (Ticket Requests) 2 10 1877 May William Cullen Bryant Commemoration. Committee on Arrangements (1 of 5) 3 1 1878 Scope and Contents Note

Includes minutes of committee meetings, lists of individuals sitting on the stage for the discourse by George William Curtis, Reception Committee candidates, and other lists.

 William Cullen Bryant Commemoration. Committee on Arrangements (2 of 5) OS-1 5 1878 Scope and Contents Note

Includes two seating charts of the Academy of Music, with some annotations indicating box seat assignments for some individuals.

 William Cullen Bryant Commemoration. Committee on Arrangements (3 of 5) 3 2 1878 December Access Restrictions

The original President Hayes letter is restricted. Researchers will be given a photocopy to use.

 Scope and Contents Note

Includes acceptances to attend the event from U.S. President Rutherford B. Hayes and from four Cabinet officials. Includes correspondence between Committee members.

 William Cullen Bryant Commemoration. Committee on Arrangements (4 of 5) 3 3 1878 December Scope and Contents Note

Includes acceptances and regrets concerning invitations to be on the event's Reception Committee.

 William Cullen Bryant Commemoration. Committee on Arrangements (5 of 5) 3 4 1874, 1878 Scope and Contents Note

Includes printed invitations and tickets. The folder also includes two forms of 1874 related to Bryant: a form for subscribing toward funds for a vase in honor of Bryant to be placed in the Metropolitan Museum of Art and a form directed to Bryant informing him of the initiative.

 William Cullen Bryant Commemoration. Correspondence (Ticket Requests) (1 of 2) 3 5 1878 December William Cullen Bryant Commemoration. Correspondence (Ticket Requests) (2 of 2) 3 6 1878 December William Cullen Bryant Commemoration. Clippings 3 7 1878 December William Bradford Commemoration (200th Anniversary of Introduction of Printing in New York). Committee Resolutions & Reports (1 of 2) 15 1 1893 William Bradford Commemoration (200th Anniversary of Introduction of Printing in New York). Committee Resolutions & Reports (2 of 2) 15 2 1893 William Bradford Commemoration (200th Anniversary of Introduction of Printing in New York). Correspondence (1 of 2) 15 3 1893 William Bradford Commemoration (200th Anniversary of Introduction of Printing in New York). Correspondence (2 of 2) 15 4 1893 William Bradford Commemoration (200th Anniversary of Introduction of Printing in New York). Invitation Lists 15 5 1893 William Bradford Commemoration (200th Anniversary of Introduction of Printing in New York). Library Reception Tickets 15 6 1893 May 21 William Bradford Commemoration (200th Anniversary of Introduction of Printing in New York). Remarks of John A. King 15 7 1893 April 8 William Bradford Commemoration (200th Anniversary of Introduction of Printing in New York). Research Notes (1 of 2) 15 8 1893 Scope and Contents Note

This folder and the next include notes regarding N-YHS's research into the location of Bradford's printing office.

 William Bradford Commemoration (200th Anniversary of Introduction of Printing in New York). Research Notes (2 of 2) 15 9 1893 William Bradford Commemoration (200th Anniversary of Introduction of Printing in New York). Clippings 15 10 1893 Robert Schell Memorial Book 3 8 1901 Scope and Contents Note

Includes the memorial book produced by N-YHS.

 Robert Schell Memorial Book. German Savings Bank Memorial Book 3 9 1900 Robert Schell Memorial Book. Bank of the Metropolis Memorial Book 3 10 1900 Robert Schell Memorial Book. Minutes and Memorials 3 11 1900 Scope and Contents Note

Memorials provided for the N-YHS memorial book by: New York University, Presbyterian Hospital, Rutgers College, and Woodlawn Cemetery. Also included is a manuscript form of the N-YHS memorial.

 Robert Schell Memorial Book. Publication Preparation 3 12 [1901] Scope and Contents Note

Includes a few documents related to the printing of the memorial.

 Robert Schell Memorial Book. Correspondence 3 13 1901 Scope and Contents Note

Includes acknowledgements from institutions that received one of the distributed memorial books.

 N-YHS Centennial Banquet. Subscriptions (Ticket Purchase Commitments) (1 of 2) 4 1 1904 September-November N-YHS Centennial Banquet. Subscriptions (Ticket Purchase Commitments) (2 of 2) 4 2 1904 September-November N-YHS Centennial Banquet. Correspondence 4 3 1904 November Scope and Contents Note

Includes responses from special invitees and notices from member ticket purchasers of the names of their guests. The correspondence includes signed letters of regret from Woodrow Wilson (then President of Princeton University) and U.S. Secretary of State John Hay. The letters also include two letters of regret sent on behalf of the President from the White House.

 N-YHS Centennial Banquet. Register of Correspondents(?) 4 4 1904 N-YHS Centennial Banquet. Arrangements 4 5 1904 September-November Scope and Contents Note

Includes documents related to planning aspects of the banquet, especially the design of the commemorative menu (Dempsey & Carroll, designer), seating plan, wine purchases, and lists of attendees.

 N-YHS Centennial Banquet. Print Matter 4 6 1904 September-November Scope and Contents Note

Includes ephemera and other printed items: guest invitation, forms related to ticket subscriptions and purchases, admission tickets to dinner (men only), admission tickets to the balcony (after dinner, women only), wine list, and seating plan. Also includes two silk(?) artifacts.

 N-YHS Centennial Banquet. Commemorative Menu 4 7 1904 November 22 N-YHS Centennial Medal. Correspondence. Victor D. Brenner (Designer) 4 8 1903-1904 N-YHS Centennial Medal. Correspondence. Gorham Manufacturing Co. 4 9 1904-1905 N-YHS Centennial Medal. Offering Circulars 4 10 1904-1905 N-YHS Centennial Medal. Correspondence. Subscribers (1 of 5) 4 11 1904 October N-YHS Centennial Medal. Correspondence. Subscribers (2 of 5) 4 12 1904 October-December N-YHS Centennial Medal. Correspondence. Subscribers (3 of 5) 5 1 1905 January-June N-YHS Centennial Medal. Correspondence. Subscribers (4 of 5) 5 2 1905 September-1906 May N-YHS Centennial Medal. Correspondence (Postcards). Subscribers (5 of 5) 5 3 1905-1906 N-YHS Centennial Medal. Subscriber Lists 5 4 1904-1906 N-YHS Centennial Medal. Register of Correspondents(?) 5 5 1904 N-YHS Centennial History. Announcement Cards 5 6 1905 December Fulton Exhibition. Correspondence, Alphabetical (1 of 5) 6 1 1909 Scope and Contents Note

This set of five folders includes correspondence originally arranged in alphabetical order. Generally, this is by correspondent but related matters are held together as noted by summary notations on the reverse of each letter, which is a distinguishing characteristic of all the correspondence in these five folders. It is possible that this set of correspondence was maintained by N-YHS President Samuel V. Hoffman, who is the dominant addressee or signatory of the letters. Several of the correspondents and related subjects are also found in the second set of correspondence below.

 Fulton Exhibition. Correspondence, Alphabetical (2 of 5) 6 2 1909 Fulton Exhibition. Correspondence, Alphabetical (3 of 5) 6 3 1909 Scope and Contents Note

This folder includes a list (L) of objects promised to the exhibition and minutes (M) of two meetings of N-YHS officers, including Samuel Hoffman, with the Committee of the Colonial Dames of America, including Alice Crary Sutcliffe.

 Fulton Exhibition. Correspondence, Alphabetical (4 of 5) 6 4 1909 Fulton Exhibition. Correspondence, Alphabetical (5 of 5) 6 5 1909 Scope and Contents Note

Includes Alice Crary Sutcliffe.

 Fulton Exhibition. Correspondence, General (1 of 3) 6 6 1909-1912 Scope and Contents Note

This second set of correspondence was originally apart from the above set, and may have been a file of Librarian Robert Kelby. There is no definitive overall order to the documents, but it appears that this first folder includes correspondence with the Hudson-Fulton Celebration Commission on various matters, including the donation of the Commission's records to N-YHS, while the second and third folders include other correspondents, principally concerning exhibition loans. Several of the correspondents and topics also appear in the above set of correspondence.

 Fulton Exhibition. Correspondence, General (2 of 3) 6 7 1909-1910 Fulton Exhibition. Correspondence, General (3 of 3) 6 8 1909 Fulton Exhibition. Reproduction Permissions 6 9 [1909] Fulton Exhibition. Loan Register 5 7 1909 Scope and Contents Note

At the back of the register is an index by lender name.

 Fulton Exhibition. Loans and Loan Returns 6 10 1909 Fulton Exhibition. Registered Mail Receipts. 6 11 1909 Fulton Exhibition. Catalogue (2) 6 12 1909 Hudson-Fulton Reviewing Stand. Print Matter 7 1 1909 October Scope and Contents Note

Includes the ticket offering circular, tickets, ticket stubs, and acknowledgement forms.

 Hudson-Fulton Reviewing Stand. Payment Lists and Seating Assignments 7 2 1909 October Hudson-Fulton Reviewing Stand. Correspondence (1 of 2) 7 3 1909 October Hudson-Fulton Reviewing Stand. Correspondence (2 of 2) 7 4 1909 October Hudson-Fulton Reviewing Stand. Payment Enclosure 7 5 1909 October Stokes Reception. Correspondence with Stokes 7 6 1925-1926 Scope and Contents Note

Includes a manuscript copy of Stokes's address.

 Stokes Reception. Invitations and Event Program 7 7 1925 November Stokes Reception. Invitation Lists 7 8 1925 Stokes Reception. Invitation Response Cards 13 - 1925 Stokes Reception. Correspondence, Regrets (1 of 2) 7 9 1925 Stokes Reception. Correspondence, Regrets (2 of 2) 7 10 1925 Stokes Reception. Proceedings and Addresses (Print) 7 11 1925 November 17 Eames Reception. Invitations and Event Program 7 12 1931 November 20 Eames Reception. Attendee Lists (1 of 2) 7 13 1931 Eames Reception. Attendee Lists (2 of 2) 7 14 1931 Eames Reception. Correspondence, Acceptances (1 of 2) 8 1 1931 October-November Eames Reception. Correspondence, Acceptances (2 of 2) 8 2 1931 October-November Eames Reception. Correspondence, Regrets (1 of 2) 8 3 1931 October-November Eames Reception. Correspondence, Regrets (2 of 2) 8 4 1931 October-November Eames Reception. Proceedings and Addresses (Print) 8 5 1931 November 20 Lockman Reception. Invitations and Event Program 8 6 1933 November 20 Lockman Reception. Attendee Lists 8 7 1933 Lockman Reception. Correspondence, Acceptances 8 8 1933 November Lockman Reception. Correspondence, Regrets (1 of 2) 8 9 1933 November Lockman Reception. Correspondence, Regrets (2 of 2) 9 1 1933 November Lockman Reception. Proceedings and Addresses (Print) 9 2 1933 November 20 Lectures. Correspondence (1 of 2) 9 3 1931-1934 Scope and Contents Note

Includes marketing brochures of: speakers Charles Brook, George Francis Dow, William Osgood Field, Gilbert E. Gable, Gilbert McClurg, Harold Stark, and Fanny Washington; performers American Operatic Players, Laurance Hart (impersonating George Washington), Princess Atalie (singer), Te Ata (singer, dancer), and Lucia Gario.

 Lectures. Correspondence (2 of 2) 9 4 1933-1936 Scope and Contents Note

Includes marketing brochures of speakers Madame Barry-Orlova, Victor Branson De Cou, William Webster Ellsworth, Charles Wellington Furlong, Ellsworth Jaeger, and various from Bralans Lecture Bureau.

 CPW Opening Ceremony. Correspondence, Acceptances (1 of 5) 10 1 1939 March CPW Opening Ceremony. Correspondence, Acceptances (2 of 5) 10 2 1939 March CPW Opening Ceremony. Correspondence, Acceptances (3 of 5) 10 3 1939 March CPW Opening Ceremony. Correspondence, Acceptances (4 of 5) 10 4 1939 March CPW Opening Ceremony. Correspondence, Acceptances (5 of 5) 10 5 1939 March CPW Opening Ceremony. Correspondence, Regrets (1 of 3) 10 6 1939 March CPW Opening Ceremony. Correspondence, Regrets (2 of 3) 10 7 1939 March CPW Opening Ceremony. Correspondence, Regrets (3 of 3) 10 8 1939 March Musicale & Strawberry Festival. Correspondence (Ticket Requests) (1 of 2) 9 5 1939 May-June Musicale & Strawberry Festival. Correspondence (Ticket Requests) (2 of 2) 9 6 1939 May-June St. Nicholas Festival. Program & "Sancte Claus, Goed Heylig Man!" facsimile score 9 7 1939 December 6 Scope and Contents Note

This folder holds copies of the score that was originally distributed by N-YHS in December 1964; see also: New-York Historical Society manuscripts of lectures and addresses (NYHS-RG 11) for correspondence of 1865-1866 related to the original score.

 Emma Thursby Celebration. 9 8 1940 December Scope and Contents Note

Includes invitations, correspondence (acceptances and regrets), and event programs.

 Harry T. Peters Reception 9 9 1942 March Scope and Contents Note

Includes a small number of acceptances and regrets for a reception for lecturer Peters.

 Odell Reception. Invitations and Event Program 11 1 1942 October 23 Odell Reception. Correspondence, General (1 of 2) 11 2 1942 Odell Reception. Correspondence, General (2 of 2) 11 3 1942 Odell Reception. Invitation Lists 11 4 1942 Odell Reception. Invitation Contact Information 14 - 1942 Scope and Contents Note

Includes unused tickets to N-YHS events of September 1941-June 1942 repurposed as index cards, with contact information for potential invitees to the Odell event written on the back of the tickets.

 Odell Reception. Correspondence, Acceptances (1 of 2) 11 5 1942 October Odell Reception. Correspondence, Acceptances (2 of 2) 11 6 1942 October Odell Reception. Correspondence, Regrets (1 of 2) 11 7 1942 October Odell Reception. Correspondence, Regrets (2 of 2) 11 8 1942 October Odell Reception. Walter Hampden Address 11 9 1942 November Scope and Contents Note

Includes Hampden's remarks at the Odell event as recorded by the stenographer, with Hampden's edits.

 Odell Reception. Typescript of Proceedings 11 10 1942 October 23 Scope and Contents Note

Includes the remarks made at the event as recorded by the Stenotype Recording Company. Speakers include: George A. Zabriskie, Millard L. Robinson, Joseph Wood Krutch, Arthur Hobson Quinn, Walter Hampden, Walter Prichard Eaton, William Lyons Phelps, letter read from Nicholas Murray Butler, and George Clinton Densmore Odell.

 Odell Reception. Correspondence, Distribution of Proceedings 11 11 1943 Opening of Early American Rooms. Correspondence, Acceptances (1 of 3) 12 1 1951 May Opening of Early American Rooms. Correspondence, Acceptances (2 of 3) 12 2 1951 May Opening of Early American Rooms. Correspondence, Acceptances (3 of 3) 12 3 1951 May Opening of Early American Rooms. Correspondence, Regrets (1 of 3) 12 4 1951 May Opening of Early American Rooms. Correspondence, Regrets (2 of 3) 12 5 1951 May Opening of Early American Rooms. Correspondence, Regrets (3 of 3) 12 6 1951 May Sesqui-Centennial (150th) Anniversary. Arrangements Committee 12 7 1952-1953 Sesqui-Centennial (150th) Anniversary. Dinner Invitations, Menu, Program, Lists 12 8 1954 March-May Sesqui-Centennial (150th) Anniversary. Correspondence, Dinner Acceptances 12 9 1954 April-May Sesqui-Centennial (150th) Anniversary. Correspondence, Dinner Regrets 12 10 1954 April Sesqui-Centennial (150th) Anniversary. Dinner Remarks by Fenwick Beekman 12 11 1954 May 3 Scope and Contents Note

Includes N-YHS President Beekman's remarks introducing speaker Grayson L. Kirk.

 Sesqui-Centennial (150th) Anniversary. Meeting Invitations and Program 12 12 1954 November 19 Sesqui-Centennial (150th) Anniversary. Meeting Ticket Requests 13 - 1954 November Sesqui-Centennial (150th) Anniversary. Correspondence, Regrets 12 13 1954 November Sesqui-Centennial (150th) Anniversary. Meeting Ticket Distribution Lists 12 14 1954 November Sesqui-Centennial (150th) Anniversary. Meeting Remarks of Fenwick Beekman 12 15 [1954 November 19] Scope and Contents Note

See also New-York Historical Society manuscripts of lectures and addresses (NYHS-RG 11) for a manuscript copy of Allan Nevins's address at this event, titled "The Golden Thread in the History of New York."

 Sesqui-Centennial (150th) Anniversary. Miscellaneous 12 16 1954 Scope and Contents Note

Includes the offering brochure for purchases of the sesqui-centennial medal, an award of merit to N-YHS from the American Association for State and Local History, and invoices.

 Sesqui-Centennial (150th) Anniversary. Commemorative Medal (2) 13 1 1954 Sesqui-Centennial (150th) Anniversary. Steel Stamp 13 2 1954 Sesqui-Centennial (150th) Anniversary. Oversize OS-1 6 1953-1954 Scope and Contents Note

Includes correspondence concerning the Commemorative Medal and a poster board from 1954 signed by the N-YHS staff.

 Excess Ephemera (Restricted) 16 1870, 1877, 1904, 1939 Scope and Contents Note

This box includes only excess copies of tickets and other ephemera culled from the folders in the record group. Events represented in the box are: 66th Anniversary/Charles Francis Adams address, 100th Anniversary of the New York State Constitution/Charles O'Conor address, N-YHS Centennial Banquet, and "Sancte Claus, Goed Heylig Man!" facsimile score. Because the material is redundant it is available for internal use only.
